page.title: 01ALVES AREA
page.content: The area we have been assigned to study is based round the small rural village of Alves on the A96 between Elgin and Forres. The main industry is farming as the land is very fertile and excellent for growing crops although many cattle and sheep are raised. About one twelth of the area is covered by woodland,the rest by farmland,the largest farming concern being Moray Estates. Most of the areas amenites and public services are situated in the village some of these being a Post Office,Take Away,Petrol Station,School and a small Pub.Approximately a mile north of the village is a pleasent well equipped Caravan site. Half a mile west of the village stands Alves Church.
